name: W Dallas Victory Hotel

reviews.text: My husband proposed to me on our stay here. We had a fabulous suite with a large balcony overlooking downtown Dallas. The staff was amazing- bringing us complimentary champagne and chocolates. We dined
reviews.title: Great Night at the W

reviews.text: at the Craft which had wonderful food and service. The host made sure we made it right up to the Ghostbar afterwards for a celebration. The room was great- my only complaint was the air conditioning unit which was extremely loud and kept me up all night.
reviews.title: Overall, a Solid Hotel

reviews.text: However- I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Fantanstic, Fun and Trendy Hotel

likes.liked: — The view from the Pool Area

reviews.text: I have stayed at the W Hotel in Dallas two times in the last few months, both times for one night while traveling on business.
reviews.title: Amazing Personal Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, I have been pleased with my two stays and will likely return to this hotel the next time I travel to Dallas for work.
reviews.title: No real W flavor here

reviews.text: I stayed here for a business meeting. I had never been at a W Hotel before and I have to be honest, I never will again. As a woman traveling alone on business, I found the BLACK walls and VERY dim light in the hallways quite scary. The mirrors at the end of the hallways made it look like EXACTLY like the Twilight Zone Tower of Terror ride in Disney World. I had a nice room, but again the walls were BLACK and the lighting was so dim. It also took me FOREVER to find a socket to plug the hair dryer into since the socket plates were also black on a black wall.
reviews.title: Good stay, guess I am just not a W person

reviews.text: I will say that the staff was very friendly and helpful, however I was totally out of my element. I am not into hip and trendy hotels. If you like the nightclub scene this is the place for you. But I think next time I will pass.
reviews.title: great W experience

likes.liked: — the service, hip vibes, the design of the hotel
likes.disliked: — the location was a bummer; too far from all the action

reviews.title: Great halloween spot, it's a real horror show
reviews.text: An unbelievable horror show. From the dysfunctional valet parking arrangement to the rude front desk personnel to the dirty rooms with stingy amenities, this place makes roadside hourly motels look good. This is not just a loud poorly designed hotel with a trendy nightclub, it's a trendy nightclub attached to a horrible hotel . If you want to see the Ghost Bar, stay somewhere else and take a cab.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at several Ws across the US and was excited to stay here to celebrate my 30th birthday. However, after reading these reviews, my expectations were pretty low.
reviews.title: Not worth the price

reviews.text: The GOOD - this is one of the better looking Ws I've stayed in. A lot seem to be dark and small, but this one was very spacious and had great light and colors. The Bliss spa was also nice, but a little overpriced for Dallas spas. The Sweat gym by Larry North was fantastic - great machines and variety, even though no one was in there. The valet and staff members were helpful and pleasant.
reviews.title: W Dallas Hotel is the Worst

likes.liked: — Nothing the W Dallas is a dump
likes.disliked: — If your comming to Dallas TX and want a fun hotel, try Hotel ZaZa

reviews.text: The BAD - I really think this hotel is overpriced for what you get. We booked a package deal that included about 5 "do this and get this for free" items, but I only took advantage of 2. The pool is pretty to look at, but you can't find a seat and it's in total shade. The water was freezing and no one could bare to step in. Probably the biggest draw for this place is the ghostbar. We were told to line up in the Hotel "VIP" line by at 11:30 to get in, but don't believe that. We got down on a Sat. night around 9:30 and still had to wait about 30 min. to go up. Granted, the views are pretty awesome when you get there, but it's not as great as the line would lead you to believe.
reviews.title: Cool hotel but service is spotty, at best
Worst Hotel ever!
reviews.text: As a previous poster said, if you're looking for the hip atmosphere without breaking the bank, I prefer the Zaza over the W.
I stayed this past weekend for my bachelor party and our hotel experience for the most part was excellent.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in the W Dallas - Victory Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a Cool Corner Suite and was not let down. It was a little smaller than I anticipated, but it worked out for everyone. The door staff was awesome and really helpful. Upon unloading our vehicle they had noticed that we had bought some "adult beverages" and told us that we had to conceal it, or they wouldn't let us in with it. They were cool in that they helped us conceal it and make sure that we got it up to the room. They also helped us make reservations for typical bachelor party establishments and allowed us access to the hotel SUV rather than calling for a cab.
reviews.title: W Hotel Dallas

reviews.text: Later on we came back and went to the Ghostbar. We were told 2 people per room could get in without paying (I assumed free). When I got the bill the next morning I saw there was a $30 Ghostbar charge, and come to find out we were charged $15 per person, instead of the normal $20 cover charge. I was pretty disappointed by this as I was led to believe by the check-in staff that it was free.
reviews.title: Great hotel!!

likes.liked: — everything was very easy and the room was so modern, but comfortable at the same time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ghostbar is awesome with tons of beautiful people. The service is good and the people never really seemed "snotty" or stuck-up. We will definitely go back to the Ghostbar the next time we are in town, likely to be OU/TX weekend.
reviews.title: The least impressive 'W Hotel' in the US.

likes.liked: — The service and the lobby decor.
likes.disliked: — The loud music in the lobby and the 'club scene' throughout hotel at all hours of the day/night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've read the previous reviews. A lot of negative reviews are true, but the negatives shouldn't ruin your stay. The biggest plus is that the staff is wonderful. The lobby has a sleek, modern appearance with some lovely flower and fruit arrangements. The check in process was done quickly.
reviews.title: Neat hotel, but we had some issues

reviews.text: I have stayed at a number of W hotels with widely variable experiences. The W Dallas is definitely on the better end of the spectrum.
reviews.title: Better than average W hotel with great restaurant and bar

likes.liked: — Great restaurant on site, near AA arena, comfortable beds

reviews.text: The hotel is relatively new, very clean and had well-furnished and designed rooms. There were plenty of outlets, a large flat-screen TV and internet that worked as promised. Room service was prompt and accurately delivered (note - why is it normally so difficult to get proper ice coffee in the South?).
reviews.title: Great Hotel if you're 21

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed is very comfortable and even though I was on a high floor (close to the top floor club) I had no problems with noise. The bathrooms are also well furnished.
reviews.title: W: 2 Kool 4 U

likes.disliked: — The effect that W style and branding has on its guests

reviews.text: Most surprising for a W was that I experienced excellent service. Faxes and car valet were promptly delivered and wakeup calls/room service occurred when scheduled. Further, the receptionist offered an upgrade based on my Gold SPG status.
reviews.title: WARNING for visitors!

reviews.text: The Craft restaurant downstairs was excellent and the club was busy (this on a Tuesday night).
reviews.title: See and Be Seen

reviews.text: I liked the W very much. I liked the color change of The Living Room bar and the drinks were very tasty, although a bit expensive but it is a W. There was also a free laptop connected with wi-fi for use in the lobby, which was very handy for me since I forgot my laptop adaptor at home.
reviews.title: Very hip but watch out for that glass door in the bathroom

likes.disliked: — Almost too much attention from the staff

reviews.text: There were a few odd details about the place:
reviews.title: Dallas Crowd, Marginal Rooms

likes.disliked: — The room was a bit shabby.

reviews.text: 1) My cover sheet was kind of shredded - not like big giant gaping holes but the stitching was definitely coming out like maybe a cat had jumped on it. Which was odd, considering the hotel's attention to detail and the fact that it is not very old.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the W - it's not your father's hotel!

reviews.text: 2) The glass wall that separates the shower from the sink left me bruised on the top of my head. It is very thick glass.
reviews.title: Wonderful Improvements!

reviews.text: 3) The pool on the 16th floor has a very thorough set of rules of what can be done and what can not be done in the pool, including no blowing of your nose. Useful - yes. Annoying - definitely. Also, I would think the pool on the other side of the landing would have been a better place for it - instead of a view of Downtown Dallas, you get a view of the highway and a construction zone.
reviews.title: Anywhere but here

likes.liked: — The drive out the parking lot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This has to be one the most pretentious hotels in the USA, with no real reason for being so. From the moment you arrive to see upwards of 6 bell boys all dressed in khaki shorts to the minute you leave you will be amazed at how surface over substance runs right through this hotel's attitude to service. Make no mistake, there has been a lot of money spent on this establishment but you never feel welcome. The room was comfortable but somewhat cold in its design. The public areas are more like a boutique shop than a place you would want to relax. The attitude of the young lady who checked us out was astonishing in its coldness and complete lack of charm. She never asked if everything was ok or if we had enjoyed our stay. Just a "there's your bill", not even a goodbye!
reviews.title: Poor Experience in Dallas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will watch with interest future reviews of this place.
reviews.title: Way Better Than Reviewed

likes.liked: — Newest chic hotel property in Dallas/Fort Worth.
likes.disliked: — Prices are highest of just about any W nationwide.

reviews.text: When in Dallas (for business) I always stay at the Grand Hyatt at the Airport (one of my favorite hotels to date - don't laugh - it is a first rate hotel and perfect for business travelers). However, I thought I would try this place since it is fairly new. What a waste of time and money. Wish I would have read the not so great reviews prior to my stay - they were all spot on!
reviews.title: Skip This Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, location is totally awkward. Second, the place is run by a completely amateur staff. Young kids have been clearly hired for their alleged "hipness" but the simple things - directions, printing boarding pass, check-in - seemed a bit beyond this crew's capabilities. Conceriege seemed totally perplexed that we were asking for help. As one previous reviewer said, this place is trying way too hard to be hip and cool and in doing so, it is actually just quite humorous to see all these people taking themselves so seriously as they pretend to know how to work in a hotel.
reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations

reviews.text: Ghost Bar is OK but no real views to speak of. Room layout, as one previous reviewer indicated, is completely odd. Good luck finding electrical outlets for a hair dryer - none in the "bathroom" area. Hint - look behind the LG flat screen TV. Also, for such a new hotel, I was shocked at how run down it appears to be already. Furniture looks like they picked it up at a Wal-Mart clearance sale. Its all nicked and cheaply made and doesn't at all fit with decor. Rugs in halls and rooms are already worn.
reviews.title: Best Ever Hotel Experience!

likes.liked: — Whenever/Whenever service, friendly and courtesy staff, and services made for you.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Take a pass on this place. Check out the Grand Hyatt at the airport instead - you won't be disappointed!
reviews.title: Dont waste your money!

reviews.text: I would say that the W Hotel “Exceeded Expectations”. A little snobby yet professional, welcoming, and so close to American Airlines Center that makes it the place to stay if you want to stay in town for a Stars or Mavs game. Everyone tried hard to please. Compared to the W’s in Chicago and NYC I have frequented, the Dallas W has a ways to go to get its own personality. Our room was a corner WOW suite with a balcony w/ sofa. Very nice.
reviews.title: Very cool but weird

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby and public areas are beautiful. The hallways where the rooms are located are extremely dark. I thought the lights had gone out on the one of the floors, but every floor the elevator stopped at was like this.
reviews.title: Form Before Function

likes.liked: — No privacy. It was like bunking on a friend's couch.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was set up in a weird way. Right inside the entry you have part of the bathroom: The shower and sink. The toilet is in a separate little room and there is a curtain to close off the bathroom area from the bedroom, but NOT from the front door!
reviews.title: Disappointed in W

likes.disliked: — Ghost Bar Doorman, lobby bar full of non-guests.

reviews.text: This makes if very awkward for two people sharing a room. Two businessmen for example could not have one showering while the other has a guest. You can't even have a husband and wife order room service and let one shower, as there is no way to let the Room Service person come in the room past the see-through shower! Even standing in the doorway, the room service person gets a good look at whoever is in the shower.
reviews.title: Staff Ruins the Experience

likes.disliked: — Staff in general is very rude and snotty

reviews.text: It's just poorly thought out!
reviews.title: Too trendy
No value at all
reviews.text: My wife and I decided to go to the first annual MystiQal event at Victory Center last Saturday night. She is a Gold Starwood Elite, and we used points for the stay. The check-in was smooth, the room was nice, but the experience in the lobby bar and the deck for the parade were extremely disappointing. Despite the rates charged for the hotel, the hotel became jam packed with street people, mostly drunk 20-somethings that were obviously not staying at the hotel. The Ghost Bar had an extremely rude doorman trying to control the door as well. I realize it was an attempt at trying to replicate Mardis Gras, and you have to put the stay in perspective, however management did a poor job of thinking this through. Long story short, we paid too much, even if it was points, to have a very mediocre experience. "W" may want to replace the word "wish" with "over-rated". on the bed pillow.

reviews.title: Nice hotel, but overpriced.
reviews.text: The hotel itself is nice, but very expensive for what it is. Our concierge was very nice and helpful, and the room was awesome. We stayed there because of how close it is to the American Airlines Center, and that was great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I guess it was hip and we are not-but the minimalist look got in the way of comfort in so many ways. The lobby was freezing, the room was so hip there were no drawers for our clothes, the guest services book-was not a book but little cards that were hard to read. The one on the gym (Sweat) did not give any info. Finding Sweat was impossible without calling and asking for directions. However, once there it was truly great. The shower was cool to look at but the one head is in the ceiling and just rains straight down-no tub and no doors. With valet parking basic room was $400-- they charge an additional $11 bucks a day for wireless service-- come on how cheezy is that. Enjoyed Craft, the waiters were great- not at all too hip. Food was excellent and service was relaxed but efficient. When this place becomes unhip it is in trouble, because there is little in the way of comfort and convenience- high priorities for these travelers.
reviews.title: A Little too Minimalist for comfort

reviews.text: If your comming to Dallas skip the W Hotel. W Hotel Dallas TX has very small rooms, bad room design, dirty halls, small pool thats ice cold and is over priced. I was very disappointed with my stay there. The staff was nice.
reviews.title: Got down to business at the Ghostbar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here one night for our anniversary. I wanted to see it as I had heard so much and had stayed at a W in NY. We live in Dallas area so this was just a get away. The room was ok but furniture looked cheap and I don't like having my bathroom in the same room as my bed! Service was nice and they had a little welcome gift for us which was nice. Loved the pool! That was my favorite thing.
reviews.title: So over-hyped!

likes.disliked: — Ghost Bar and people at the hotel at night and room was hot.

reviews.text: Bed was ok but the room was hot and could not get the temp right. The hotel is over-run by 20 somethings and is very loud at night. We were told on check in that we could go up to Ghost Bar at no cost as hotel guests and that our name was on a "list". After dinner I wanted to see the bar as it was hyped so much. Well there was no list and they charged my husband $15 for the privilige of going up there, I was free... whoopeee! What a disappointment when we got there. This is just a bar where there is no seating because all the seats and tables are reserved for people who are not there and never showed while we were there. We went out on the "see through" balcony which was no big deal. The place was so boring we just left after one drink. that was the bummer of the night.
reviews.title: Too Cool. I mean it.

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Mansion and Four Seasons and had a much better time, I will just stick with class over trendy, thank you.
reviews.title: Avoid The W and its Hostile Staff

likes.disliked: — Terrible Service - Angry, Uncooperative Staff Members

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is place is cool. I mean Too Cool in that degenerate "LA Wannabe" kind of way. Rooms are poorly lit, pretentiously decorated and electrical outlets are hard to find but, hey, who needs electricity? Sorry, I don't need the shower in my bedroom. Redeeming factor - the bed is comfortable. I do not recommend this hotel for middle-aged business travelers.
reviews.title: Thoroughly not impressed

likes.liked: — The layout of the room, balcony & view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful rooms, but the worst service ever. We were there for a party in the ballroom and stayed the night. Valet left us standing in the cold, so we carried our own bags upstairs. Not typically a big deal, but we paid a total of $34 for the privilege of parking our car at the hotel overnight. There is no other option--valet only. For $34 they could at least acknowledge us. Bartenders at the party were incompetent; there were long lines, and drinks were not mixed correctly. There was a problem with our bill, and the front desk and one of the managers were very confrontational and hostile. We were very excited to stay at the hotel before we arrived, but we left with a horrible experience that cost us $300 for the night. We tried twice to resolve the issue with the bill, but no one will return a call or an e-mail. Starwood needs to intervene quickly. We won't ever return.
reviews.title: A must!!!

description: W Dallas located in Victory Park, a posh playground near Downtown, Uptown, Turtle Creek, the high-style Design District, and the city's nightspots. Enjoy our newly renovated rooms, complete with cowboy chic accents sure to knock your boots off!
